Package structures

Class Board

java.lang.Object
structures.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Rutgers CS213 Sp21 Group 30 Chess Assignment Board will be made of Spots and can print its current state.

This class also contains all the functionality for a board to observe, interpret, and act upon its current board-state.

Author:
Rob Kulesa, Aaron Kan

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Spot lastMove
    A Spot that is used to hold the last move made on the board This will be updated after every move.
    (package private) Spot[][] spotMat
    A 2-dimensional array of Spots that correspond to a chessboard and holds all the Pieces and their locations using these Spot instances

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    A constructor that sets spotMat to the standard chessboard size of 8x8 and sets value in that matrix to a Spot that corresponds to an actual location on the chessboard

  • Field Details

    • spotMat

      Spot[][] spotMat
      A 2-dimensional array of Spots that correspond to a chessboard and holds all the Pieces and their locations using these Spot instances

    • lastMove

      Spot lastMove
      A Spot that is used to hold the last move made on the board This will be updated after every move.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      A constructor that sets spotMat to the standard chessboard size of 8x8 and sets value in that matrix to a Spot that corresponds to an actual location on the chessboard

  • Method Details

    • makeCopy

      public Board makeCopy()
      This method returns an instance of Board that is an exact copy of the current board and its board-state
      Returns:
      Board A clone of the current board instance

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Looks at each row and prints each square from left to right while going through the rows starting from the top and ending to the bottom. Also, it prints out the coordinates at the right and bottom edges of the board.

    • initBoard

      public void initBoard()
      Sets all the pieces of a standard chess game into their standard places. Sets the pieces of certain Spot instances of the Spot 2-d matrix spotMat in the instance of Board that runs this method.

    • checkString

      public boolean checkString​(java.lang.String cmdString, int turncount)
      This method checks if the command a user is attempting to execute on the board is properly formatted. If it makes it to the return statement, it recognizes that the command is properly formatted and then proceeds to call checkMove to determine move validity according to the board and its game-state.
      Parameters:
      cmdString - The user-inputted string used to potentially execute a command
      turncount - records which turn is currently taking place in the game
      Returns:
      boolean A value that indicates the validity of a move as determined by checkMove

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove​(Spot from, Spot to, java.lang.Character promoRequest)
      checkMove determines validty first by the following means:
      1. Checking path validity as specified by the command and according to the rules of chess
      2. Determine if the move in question fits the mold of a special move This includes enpassant, castling, and promotion.
      3. If it does, we determine if the special move is valid considering the user-input and the board-state
      4. Lastly, it determines if the move in question will place the Piece's own King in check.
      If a move is valid through all these checks, it is considered a valid move
      Parameters:
      from - The Spot on the board that the move origniates from
      to - The Spot on the board that piece will end up on after the move is executed
      promoRequest - A Character that stores a promotion request as indicated by the user. Will be null if there is no stated promotion request.
      Returns:
      boolean that indicates if a move from one Spot on the board to another spot is valid or not.

    • piecesInWay

      public boolean piecesInWay​(java.util.ArrayList<Spot> path, int team)
      piecesInWay analyzes a path and determines if there are spots that would inhibit the movement of a piece that wants to move to the last Spot entry of its path.
      Parameters:
      path - the path a given piece wants to take
      team - the team of that given piece.
      Returns:
      boolean determines if there is a spot on the path that would inhibit movement

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece​(java.lang.String cmdString)
      Analyzes a user inputted command and executes it on the current board instance. Updates lastTurn and will remove the opponent's piece if a take is detected.
      Parameters:
      cmdString - a user-inputted command that moves one piece from one Spot on the board to another. This command is assumed to be valid and correctly formatted.

    • findKing

      public Spot findKing​(int team)
      Looks through all Spot instances in the current Board instance's spotMat and locates the King piece of an indicated team
      Parameters:
      team - The team whose King location we are interested in finding
      Returns:
      Spot the location of the indicated team

    • isTeamInCheck

      public static boolean isTeamInCheck​(Board board, int evaluatedTeam)
      Returns true if the evaluated team's king is in check for the given board instance.
      Parameters:
      board - an instance of the board with all the pieces to be evaluated
      evaluatedTeam - the king of this team will be evaluated for check status
      Returns:
      boolean whether the king of the evaluated team is in check

    • isTeamInCheckMate

      public boolean isTeamInCheckMate​(int evaluatedTeam)
      Returns true if the evaluated team's king is in checkmate for the current board instance.
      Parameters:
      evaluatedTeam - the king of this team will be evaluated for checkmate status
      Returns:
      boolean whether the king of the evaluated team is in checkmate
